title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 22 December 2016 - BBC News
summary: man 's body found in sea at hell 's mouth .
wheelie bin murder accused denies killing 30-year-old man .
four months of roadworks on a38 in cornwall .
plymouth argyle are through to the third round of the fa cup to face premier league giants liverpool .
'generous donors ' send aid from cornwall to aleppo .
vandals damage bodmin christmas tree for second time this year .
rail passengers from devon to london warned to expect disruption .
a mile-long stretch of trees along the a38 has been chopped down - because of squirrels .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on friday .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon & cornwall for today , we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all the day 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
do n't miss bbc spotlight at 18:30 and the late bulletin at 22:30 tonight .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: escaped sheep put in police car after baaaaad behaviour
text: police officers in plymouth cornered an escaped sheep and put it into their patrol car .

with the help of local resident katy young , officers were able to catch the sheep in the rear garden of a house in priory drive , plympton and eventually put the sheep in the rear of the patrol car .
it was taken to a local farm for safe keeping until the owner could be found .
officers posted on their plympton police facebook page saying it was : `` all good fun . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: debbie miners from camborne banned from making nuisance 999 calls after abusing emergency staff
text: a camborne woman has been given a jail sentence after making persistent nuisance calls and abusing police , ambulance and nhs staff .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: 'bored devon oap ' joe bartley 's christmas party cheer
text: bored pensioner joe bartley is all smiles as he celebrates christmas with his new friends at the restaurant where he now works .
mr bartley , 89 , from paignton in devon , put an ad in his local paper , the herald express , pleading for a job to stop him from `` dying of boredom '' .
the cantina made him a waiter and kitchen hand and last night he got a kiss from staff at the christmas party .
`` they are lovely people here , i had a great time , '' he said .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: elderly woman fighting for life in derriford after serious crash closes road this afternoon
text: an elderly woman has been airlifted to derriford hospital after a serious two-vehicle crash this afternoon .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: tonight 's weather : showers will ease and frost will form
text: any remaining showers will ease through the evening with clear spells for most , allowing a local frost to form .
the cloud and wind will increase from the west towards dawn though .
the minimum temperature will be 3c ( 37f ) .
tomorrow will see very strong winds with local gales , especially over coasts and hills such as dartmoor .
a band of locally heavy rain will then move south-eastwards , clearing all parts through the evening .
the maximum temperature will be 12c ( 54f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: today 's headlines in devon and cornwall
text: today 's headlines in devon and cornwall
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: cleaners to strike on great western railway
text: cleaners from the transport union rmt will strike tomorrow over `` serious bullying , claims of discrimination and poverty working conditions '' on the great western railway train cleaning contract operated by servest uk .
members have been instructed not to book on for any shifts between 0559 on friday and 0558 on saturday , rmt said .
cleaners will be at paddington station from 06:00 tomorrow .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: diocese hopes for warm welcome for refugees
text: the bishop of truro is `` delighted '' the diocese has agreed to buy a house in cornwall for syrian refugees .
the right reverend tim thornton , bishop of truro , said : i am delighted we can help assist those who have had to flee their homes and am sure they will be given a warm welcome here in cornwall . ''
the property will be to provide so-called 'move-on accommodation ' for people coming to cornwall under the syrian vulnerable person resettlement programme .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: south west expected to escape worst of storm barbara
text: south west expected to escape worst of storm barbara

documents.title: children in war-torn aleppo receive aid from cornwall
text: thousands of children have reached relative safety and been given aid from cornish charity shelterbox .
the aid shown is hats and scarves - .
essential as it has started to snow in the region - and other non-food items supplied by the charity , and given out by aid workers from in-country partner , london-based hand in hand for syria .
the children and their families have been taken by bus to displacement camps - the actual locations of this latest aid distribution are being withheld for security reasons .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon and cornwall rail passengers travelling to london face disruption
text: rail passengers planning to travel to london paddington this christmas are facing disruption .
the london station will be closed for overground services from christmas eve , on saturday , until thursday 29 december .
trains will stop at ealing broadway and passengers will be able to use the underground .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: squirrels blamed for tree devastation
text: squirrels have been blamed for the devastation of a mile-longstretch of trees on the a38 between dobwalls and bodmin .
the boconnoc estate , which owns the land , says the overgrown beech hedging along the glynn valley had to be chopped down because branches were dropping onto the road .
author: Christine Butler
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: car trapped by shifting sands of burgh island causeway
text: a driver got into deep water after apparently failing to recognise the risks of trying to drive over the sandy causeway to burgh island .
the causeway has been a graveyard for a number of vehicles in the past due to its soft sandy structure and the nearby sea , which covers it at high tide .
this driver avoided being engulfed by the rising waters - his audi estate was towed out by a friendly farmer !
`` fun and games on the beach this morning , '' wrote wendy hodges-jackson who took the `` stay safe this christmas . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: pictures show devastation following airing cupboard fire
text: residents in trevarnon lane , connor downs said a fire alarm fitted by cornwall fire service `` saved their lives '' when a fire started in an airing cupboard .
at 22:11 on tuesday crews from hayle and tolvaddon community fire stations were mobilised to a report of a house fire .
the fire was extinguished by a crew wearing breathing apparatus and using a hose reel .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: diocese to buy house for refugees
text: the diocese of truro is buying a house in cornwall to provide a home for syrian refugees .
it is not yet know where the house will be .
- the property will provide so-called 'move-on accommodation ' for people coming to cornwall under the syrian vulnerable person resettlement programme .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: hot fuzz eat your heart out : police corner escaped sheep
text: police in plympton were called to some `` early morning sheep herding '' .
a post on plympton police 's facebook page says : `` local officers were called to a sheep making a break for freedom in the st maurice area of the stannary .
the wooly fella was running a mock all over the area , it even attempted to get into the dentist surgery , we were reliably informed that no appointment had been booked . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: man 's body found in sea at hell 's mouth
text: the body of a man has been found in the water at hell 's mouth at gwithian after the emergency services were called there late last night .
police officers , the portreath cliff rescue team and the st ives lifeboat crew were all involved .
his next of kin have been informed and a formal identification has taken place .
the death is not being treated as sus and a file has been prepared for the coroner .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: henri lloyd store targeted by thieves in early morning hammer raid
text: the henri lloyd store in salcombe was targeted by thieves at about 03:15 this morning , police say .

a blue ford ka was spotted outside the store on the high street and at least two white men were seen to have used hammers to gain access to the store and steal clothing before fleeing the area in the car .

police would like to hear from anyone who saw anything sus anyone who saw a blue ford ka in the area before or after the raid , and would like to hear from anyone who has been offered any items of henri lloyd clothing for sale .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: a390 closed eastbound due to accident
text: a390 closed eastbound due to accident

documents.title: ferry christmas : third torpoint ferry back up and running
text: one of the torpoint ferries , which has been out of service for more than a week , has been fixed .
a three ferry service is running again between torpoint and devonport after a missing link on one of the ferries was fixed .
it has been out of service since 17 december .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: wanted sheep evades capture by police in plymouth
text: after giving officers the run-around , a sheep on the lamb in plympton has been caught by the police .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'generous donors ' send aid from cornwall to aleppo
text: children from aleppo have made it to displacement camps and been given aid donations from a cornish charity .

sam hewett from shelterbox said : `` the fighting in and around aleppo that has been broadcast in recent weeks is indicative of the intolerable position that people throughout syria are forced to endure .

`` due to the support of our generous donors , shelterbox has been able to support people as they are evacuated from the city with items such as clothing and bedding , to shelter them from the cold winter conditions . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: crash victim named as 91-year-old margaret pine
text: a 91-year-old woman who died following a crash in barnstaple on saturday night has been named as margaret pine .
emergency services were called after a car crashed into a wall during thick fog on old bideford road near to birch lane .
three elderly women in the vehicle sustained serious injuries and were all taken to north devon district hospital .
mrs pine , from barnstaple , was a passenger in the vehicle and sustained multiple injuries .
she died in hospital in the early hours of tuesday morning .
the other two women , aged 76 and 85 and both from barnstaple , remain in hospital .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: argyle v liverpool : thousands of tickets go on sale on boxing day
text: argyle v liverpool : thousands of tickets go on sale on boxing day

documents.title: lonely donkey finds love in time for christmas
text: a lonely donkey has found love at an animal sanctuary in cornwall just in time for christmas .
thirteen-year-old lottie was a badly treated beach donkey who arrived at the sanctuary in a `` very depressed state '' but has now formed a special bond with another rescue donkey , hamish .
hear more on bbc radio cornwall with julie skentelbery after 17:00 .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel update : collision on m5 southbound
text: travel update : collision on m5 southbound
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: argyle to take on liverpool for first time in more than 50 years
text: plymouth argyle 's third round fa cup match will be the first time they have taken on liverpool in more than 50 years .
the last time the pilgrims played liverpool was in the 1961/1962 season when they were playing in what was then division two - the reds ran out winners 2-1 at anfield and 3-2 at home park .
the two teams have never met before in the fa cup and in their 10 meetings in division two argyle took the honours in two and liverpool in five .
argyle will travel to anfield on sunday 8 january .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: helston town council wants to take over car parks following cornwall council proposal to raise fees
text: a fight back has begun to reclaim helston 's car parks for the town .
author: Falmouth Packet

documents.title: forty years since sex pistols cancelled torquay gig
text: today marks 40 years since the sex pistols played their controversial anarchy tour in plymouth .
on 22 december they were due to play in torquay - but it was cancelled - as no venues would host the punk band .
so they played a second night in plymouth - the last of their tour in 1976 .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: four months of roadworks on a38 in cornwall
text: the new year will see more roadworks on the a38 glynn valley , in cornwall .
a four-month project to improve safety at lower lodge will involve reinforcing the carriageway , building a new retaining wall and barriers and improving drainage .
the work is costing £ 3.6m and will involve some overnight closures and daytime diversions .
julian strong from highways england says they will try to keep disruption to a minimum .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: christmas gift of cannabis sent through the post intercepted by newton abbot police
text: a christmas parcel that contained the gift of cannabis has been intercepted by police in newton abbot .
author: Torquay Herald Express

documents.title: travel news : broken down vehicles causing delays
text: travel news : broken down vehicles causing delays
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: wheelie bin murder trial date set for july
text: the trial of two men accused of the murder of 30-year-old james woodhouse will take place in july , a court has heard .
the body of the fundraiser was found in a wheelie bin in exeter in november .
brett edwards , 37 , of okehampton road , st thomas , has pleaded not guilty to murder , and thomas killen , 32 , of north lawn court , exeter has not yet entered a plea .
both men were remanded in custody following the hearing at exeter crown court .
the judge was told that a two to three week long trial date has been set for july 10 next year .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: toilets damaged as vandals target christmas tree
text: public toilets in bodmin were vandalised on the same evening the town 's christmas tree was damaged .
vandals forced entry and caused damage to the priory park toilets - specifically the parent and child changing unit , while the christmas tree 's lights were cut in five different places .
work is already under way by to rectify the damage this morning .
the council has encouraged any witnesses to come forward with any information .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: heroic pc took her own life as she struggled with work pressures
text: a police officer who received a bravery award at downing street killed herself as she struggled with her workload and management who were ''out to get her '' , an inquest heard .
author: Exeter Express & Echo

documents.title: breakingwheelie bin murder accused denies killing 30-year-old man
text: two men have appeared in court today charged with the murder of 30-year-old james woodhouse , whose body was found in a wheelie bin in exeter in november .
brett edwards , 37 , of okehampton road , st thomas , exeter , appeared via a prison video link and pleaded not guilty to murder .
thomas killen , 32 , of north lawn court , exeter , is also charged with mr woodhouse 's murder between november 10 and 21 this year , but has not yet entered a plea .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel update : tavistock street blocked
text: travel update : tavistock street blocked
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: temporary homeless hostel hosts nine people on first night
text: a temporary homeless hostel in exeter has opened - and nine people slept there on the first night .
exeter safe sleep , on market street , will provide food for clients cooked by volunteers .
john isserlis said on twitter : `` i ca n't believe we managed to do this .
great # partnership & support for # exetersafesleep @ colabexeter @ exetercouncil @ dc police ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: fire services called to yacht fire but obstructed by bad parking
text: firefighters are urging people to pay more attention at parking as they were delayed after a yacht fire .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: vandals damage bodmin christmas tree for second time this year
text: bodmin 's christmas tree has been targeted by vandals for the second time this year .
bodmin town council said it was `` extremely disappointed '' to report further vandalism and criminal damage to the christmas tree and lights at the mount folly .
it happened on wednesday evening when the lights were severed in five places and the folly area was left littered with broken glass .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : mostly dry with spells of sunshine
text: most places will be dry today with spells of sunshine .
some showers will affect areas mainly close to the north coast , although one or two will move further inland to the southeast .
light or moderate southwesterly winds will be fresher near the north coast .
the maximum temperature will be 11c .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bark nibbling squirrels 'cause a danger to traffic '
text: squirrels have been blamed for the devastation of a mile-long stretch of trees on the a38 between dobwalls and bodmin in cornwall .

the boconnoc estate , which owns the land , says squirrels have been nibbling the bark off the beech trees and dropping it on the road below , making it a danger to the traffic - and so the trees had to be chopped down .
locals are unhappy about the felling but the estate says it was told by highways england to carry out the work .
one local resident libby pidcock said : `` i 'm appalled , it looks like the trees have been vandalised they look like jagged teeth '' .
author: Christine Butler
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: more than £ 6,000 of perfume stolen from boots store
text: more than £ 6,000 worth of chanel and dior fragrances have been stolen from a boots store in cornwall .
police believe it happened on sunday at about 14:15 at the west cornwall shopping park in hayle .
a devon and cornwall police spokesperson said : `` whoever did this is likely to be offering cheap chanel or dior perfumes .
`` if anyone is offered such products and is uncertain of where it was sourced from , please contact us . ''
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: excitement over argyle tie
text: radio devon 's gordon sparks has n't wasted any time after plymouth argyle secured a fa cup third-round tie against liverpool by beating newport county last night # greenarmy

documents.title: 'uk 's first crop ' of sichuan pepper to be grown in devon
text: what is thought to be the uk 's first commercial crop of sichuan pepper will be grown in devon , as part of a scheme to grow trees and crops together in the same fields .
the peppers will be grown alongside apple and elderflower trees .
it 's said to be a more efficient way of using land .
marina o'connell will be growing apple trees on the site near dartington .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: two elderly people airlifted to hospital after crash
text: two elderly people have been airlifted to hospital after a crash on the a390 at penpillick , near st blazey .
the crash happened at about 15:15 on wednesday between a volkswagen polo and a nissan nv200 people carrier .
the two elderly people in the polo were airlifted to derriford hospital and are being treated for serious injuries .
the two people in the other vehicle were treated at the scene for minor injuries .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: festive royal marines land on cornwall beach
text: festive royal marines land on cornwall beach
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel update : overturned horsebox blocks lane on a30
text: on the a30 between okehampton services and whiddon down , heading towards exeter , one lane is blocked due to an overturned horsebox .
there is slow traffic in the area .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: rail passengers from devon to london warned to expect disruption
text: rail passengers from devon planning to travel to london paddington this christmas are being warned to expect disruption .
the station will be closed from christmas eve to thursday 29 december .
trains will stop at ealing broadway and passengers will be able to use the underground .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: carey targets liverpool fa cup upset
text: liverpool-supporting plymouth argyle midfielder graham carey hopes they can cause an fa cup upset when they visit anfield in round three .
carey 's penalty in the second period of extra-time sealed a 1-0 win at newport county in a second round replay .
`` we 're going to go there and try and get a result , '' 27-year-old carey said .
`` no-one will give us a shot at getting a result , but we 've showed we can battle as a team and it 's the fa cup so you never know .

`` my whole family are mainly liverpool fans , so i 'm sure some of them will make the trip over , '' added the irishman , who is rated as one of argyle 's top players , having scored 10 goals in 27 games this season .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: child maintenance payments shortage in cornwall
text: a campaign group fighting for the rights of single parents says £ 21.8m of child maintenance is owed to parents in cornwall .
the figures from the charity gingerbread have been drawn from official statistics .

jo stone , a family lawyer with stephens scown in truro , told bbc radio cornwall he 's not surprised by the figure as `` there 's very little '' single parents can do to recover the money that has n't been paid .
a new system introduced in 2013 means the onus is on parents to work out how much maintenance should be paid .
previously the courts could assess cases individually .
author: Matt Pengelly
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: lettings agency boss arrested in fraud and money laundering investigation
text: the director of a plymouth letting agency has been arrested by police on sus of theft , fraud and money laundering , the herald has learned .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: travel news : lane blocked on a30 due to overturned vehicle
text: travel news : lane blocked on a30 due to overturned vehicle
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: police appeal after motorcyclist suffers 'potentially life changing injuries '
text: police are appealing for witnesses following a crash that left a motorcyclist in hospital with `` potentially life changing injuries '' .
at about 16:45 on wednesday a honda 125 motorcycle and a renault clio crashed on the b3274 near st austell .
the 23-year-old motorcyclist was taken by ambulance to derriford hospital with serious injuries to his arms , pelvis and legs .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: waldrom can be top try scorer - baxter
text: exeter chiefs boss rob baxter says thomas waldrom is capable of being the premiership 's top try-scorer for a third successive season .
the forward , 33 , is joint top-scorer with six tries this season , with the former england player having crossed 16 times in 2014-15 and 13 last season .
`` i would love to say he has a great opportunity to be top scorer for three seasons in a row because i 'm hoping he stays playing very well and i hope the club plays very well , '' baxter said .
`` it would be fantastic to see that , but ultimately we just have to focus on the day-by-day to make the bigger happen .

`` he puts himself in the positions to score tries , a lot of them are relatively close range , but that relies on the team getting us there and getting us close to the line , '' he added to bbc sport .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: devon men aiming to deliver aid to rebuild aleppo hospital reach turkish-syrian border
text: two men from devon , delivering aid and medical supplies , have reached the turkish-syrian border .
war photographer paul conroy from crediton , who was badly injured in an attack in syria in 2012 , and dr mark hannaford from beer in east devon left london on saturday .
the supplies will be used to rebuild a children 's hospital near aleppo .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: bright and breezy with the odd shower possible
text: it will be a bright and breezy day for all parts with sunny spells for many .
the odd shower is possible too , especially towards the north and west .
the maximum temperature will be 11c ( 52f ) .
author: Holly Green
BBC Weather

documents.title: mile-long stretch of trees chopped down because of squirrels
text: a mile long stretch of trees along the a38 in cornwall has been chopped down - because of squirrels .
locals say they 're upset the trees along the glynn valley have been felled .
but the boconnoc estate , which owns the land , says they had become dangerous as a result of squirrel damage , causing branches to drop on to the a38 , so they had to be cut down .
but locals are unhappy about the way it has been carried out .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: travel news : trains running normally after earlier disruption
text: travel news : trains running normally after earlier disruption
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: plymouth argyle to face liverpool in the fa cup
text: plymouth argyle secured an fa cup third-round tie at liverpool as graham carey 's extra-time penalty ensured they won their replay at newport county .
after a goalless 90 minutes , plymouth were awarded a penalty in the first half of extra time only for paul garita to hit the post .
this content only works in the uk .
but carey made no mistake with argyle 's second spot kick after darren jones ' rash challenge on david goodwillie .
argyle will be away to jurgen klopp 's liverpool on sunday 8 january .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: local live for thursday 22 december
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online
